recipe_long_name: Dabeli Bhajiya recipe - How to make Dabeli Bhajiya
recipe_ing:
For The Dabeli Stuffing:
 2 tbsp dabeli masala
 1 tbsp oil
 1/2 cup finely chopped onions
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 cup khajur imli ki chutney
 1 tbsp garlic chutney
 2 cups boiled , peeled and mashed potatoes
 1 tsp lemon juice
 salt to taste
 1/4 cup masala peanuts
 Other Ingredients:
 35 fresh bread slices
 oil for deep-frying
 For Serving:
 garlic chutney
 khajur imli ki chutney
recipe:
Method
Heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the dabeli masala and chilli powder and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
Add the khajur imli ki chutney, garlic chutney, potatoes, lemon juice and salt, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the masala peanuts and mix well. Keep aside to cool slightly.
How to proceed
Trim the sides of all the bread slices on a clean, dry surface and trim the sides. Keep aside.
Place a bread slice on a clean, dry surface, dip it lightly in a bowl of water and squeeze it lightly between your palms to remove the excess water.
Place a little stuffing in the centre of the bread, bring together all the sides towards the centre and seal it tightly to form a round ball.
Repeat step 2 and 3 to shape 34 more bhajiyas.
Heat the oil in a non-stick kadhai and deep-fry a few bhajia at a time on a medium flame, till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides. Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve immediately with garlic chutney and khajur imli ki chutney.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Indian Snacks for Entertaining
Deep-fried Indian Starters
Evening Tea Snacks
Deep Fry
Monsoon
Indian Birthday Party
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 45 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Methambo recipe - How to make Methambo
recipe_ing:
1 1/2 cups raw mangoes , peeled and cubed
 1 tsp salt
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 cups grated jaggery (gur)
 4 tsp chilli powder
 For The Tempering:
 4 round red chillies (boriya mirch)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 2 to 3 sticks cinnamon (dalchini)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 4 tbsp mustard (rai / sarson) oil
recipe:
Main procedure
Combine the mangoes, salt and turmeric powder and keep aside for 15 minutes.
Drain out the excess juices.
Heat the oil in a pan, add the round red chillies, mustard seeds, fenugreek seeds, cinnamon and asafoetida and sauté for a few seconds.
Add the mango cubes and sauté for 5 minutes.
Add the jaggery and stir the mixture continuously over a very slow flame till the jaggery has dissolved.
Cool the mixture completely, add the chilli powder and mix well.
Bottle in a sterilised glass jar and store in a cool dry place for upto 6 months.
This pickle is ready to eat after 3 to 4 days.
tags:
Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
Pickles / Achar
Sugar Based Pickles
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,     Maturing Time:  3 to 4 days.

recipe_long_name: Ragi Vegetable Khichyu recipe - How to make Ragi Vegetable Khichyu
recipe_ing:
1 cup ragi (nachni / red millet)
 1/2 cup grated carrot
 1/4 cup grated bottle gourd (doodhi / lauki)
 3 tbsp boiled sweet corn kernels (makai ke dane)
 3 tbsp grated coconut
 2 tbsp peanuts
 3 cups sour buttermilk
 2 tbsp sesame seeds (til)
 2 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 8 to 10 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
 For Garnishing:
 1 tbsp grated coconut
 1 tsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
recipe:
Method
Lightly roast the ragi in a kadhai, cool and grind coarsely.
Heat oil in a kadhai add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the peanuts and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add sesame seeds, ginger-green chilli pasyte and sauté for a minute.
Add  carrot, vbottle gourd, sweet corn, coconut, all dry masala powders, salt  and sauté for 3-4 minutes.
Add chaas (buttermilk), mix and bring to a boil.
Add coarse ragi flour, little by little and keep stirring continuously to avoid any lumps.
Add coriander leaves and cook stirring till thick and leaves the pan. Remove from heat.
To serve, grease a bowl with oil, spread some coconut flakes, coriander, roasted sesame seeds and fill the bowl with hot
`Khichyu`, press lightly.
Invert in a serving plate,  drizzle til oil on top and serve hot immediately.
tags:
Gujarati One Dish Meal
Saute
times: Preparation Time: 12 mins, Cooking Time: 12 mins, Total Time: 24 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Gul Papdi recipe - How to make Gul Papdi
recipe_ing:
1 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 cup jaggery (gur)
 1 tsp poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 1 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 1 tsp dessicated coconut (optional)
 5 tbsp ghee
recipe:
Sprinkle the poppy seeds on a greased 8 inch cake pan.
Melt the ghee in a pan and add the wheat flour, stirring continuously.
Sauté till you get a wonderful aroma of the wheat flour.
Remove from the flame and add the jaggery, cardamom powder and (optional) coconut. stir well.
When the jaggery melts, and the mixture has come together, pour the mixture
Cool thoroughly.
Remove after 1 hour. enjoy. it is also wonderful warm.
tags: Gujarati Sweet Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 40 minutes, Cooking Time: 1 hour, Total Time: 1 hours 40 minutes,

recipe_long_name: Rice and Masoor Dal Khichdi recipe - How to make Rice and Masoor Dal Khichdi
recipe_ing:
1 cup rice (chawal)
 1/2 cup masoor dal (split red lentil)
 1 tbsp oil
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
 4 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 1/2 tbsp chopped green chillies
 3 kokum
 1 tbsp jaggery (gur)
 1 tsp goda masala
 1 tsp coriander (dhania) and cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Wash and drained the rice and masoor dal. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a pressure cooker and add the mustards seeds.
When the the mustard seeds crackle add the asafoetida, curry leaves, turmeric, rice and masoor dal and saute for 2 minutes.
Add 4 cups of water and sauté for a few seconds.
Add all other ingredients and pressure cook on high flame for 3 whistles.
Remove from the flame, allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Serve hot with a pickle of your choice.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Maharashtrian Bhaat (Rice)
collection of khichdi recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mohanthal recipe - How to make Mohanthal
recipe_ing:
400 gms condensed milk
 3 cups besan (bengal gram flour)
 2 tbsp milk
 a few saffron (kesar) strands
 1 cup ghee
 chopped almonds (badam) and pistachios for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Combine milk and besan well ,mix well and keep aside for 30 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pan, add the besan and saute for 12 minutes.
Add the condensed milk and cook with while stirring continuously for 15 minutes or till the mixture thickens.
Add the saffron, mix well and remove from the flame and pour the mixture into a greased plate and garnish with almonds.
Cool and cut into desired pieces.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Traditional Indian Mithai
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 50 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Corn Tomato Bharta recipe - How to make Corn Tomato Bharta
recipe_ing:
2 tomatoes
 1 corn cob
 2 tbsp oil
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 1/2 tbsp chopped garlic (lehsun)
 1/2 tsp chopped green chillies
 1/2 tsp chopped ginger (adrak)
 2 tbsp chopped onions
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 1/2 tsp garam masala
 salt to taste
 2 tsp butter
 For The Garnish:
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Thread the tomatoes in a skewer.
Place the skewer on the direct flame and roast till the tomatoes starts changing its colour.
Remove the skin of tomatoes and chop the tomatoes into small pieces. Keep aside.
Roast the corn cob on an open flame till it turns brown and black in colour.
Cool and grate the corn and keep aside.
Heat the oil in pan and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the garlic, green chillies, ginger and saute for 1 minute.
Add the onions and saute till the onions turn translucent.
Add the roasted tomatoes and roasted corn, mix well and saute on a medium flame for 2 minutes
Add the chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander-cumin seeds powder, salt and garam masala, mix well and cook for 2-4 minutes.
Add the butter and remaining garlic, mix well and cook for 4 minutes on a slow flame.
Remove from the flame and transfer it into serving plate.
Serve hot and garnish with coriander.
tags:
Punjabi Sabzis
Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 25 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: White Pumpkin Basundi recipe - How to make White Pumpkin Basundi
recipe_ing:
1 ltr milk
 1 cup grated ash gourd
 1/2 tsp cardamom (elaichi) powder
 1/2 cup sugar
 of blanched almonds (badam)
recipe:
Method
Boil the milk in a thick bottom vessel. After five minutes add the pumpkin after squeezing it lightly and continue boiling for 15 minutes or until pumpkin gets cooked.
Add the sugar and boil for a few more minutes. Mix the cardamom and remove from heat. Take out in a serving bowl.
Serve either at room temperature or chilled in the fridge. Sprinkle almond slices on top.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
Traditional Indian Mithai
Raksha - Bandhan
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 25 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masala Chaas ( Spicy Buttermilk) recipe - How to make Masala Chaas ( Spicy Buttermilk)
recipe_ing:
400 ml curds (dahi)
 1 tsp black salt (sanchal)
 1 tsp chaat masala
 of ginger (adrak)
 2 green chillies , finely chopped
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp lemon juice
 a spring curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Combine the green chillies, coriander, ginger, 2-3 curry leaves and blend in a mixer into a smooth paste.
Add the curds and blend using a hand blender till smooth.
Pour this mixture in a glass.
Add chaat masala, black salt, salt, lemon juice, asafoetida and mix well.
Chill this in a refrigerator.
Garnish it with few coriander leaves and one curry leaf and serve.
tags: Gujarati  Drinks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 5 mins, Total Time: 15 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Raiwala Mirchi recipe - How to make Raiwala Mirchi
recipe_ing:
1/2 kg thick green chillies  (bhavnagari I331)
 3/4 cup black salt (sanchal)
 3/4 cup mustard (rai / sarson) powder
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tbsp lemon juice
 2 tbsp oil
recipe:
Method
Wash and dry the chillies thoroughly.
Remove the tops and slit each chilli lenghtwise. Tap to remove any excess seeds.
Mix together the black salt, mustard powder, asafoetid, turmeric powder and oil.
Fill this mixture into the chillies and place them in a sterilised bottle. Top with any remaioning mixture.
Add the lemon juice and shake the bottle well.
Store for at least 1 day before serving.
tags:
Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
Pickles / Achar
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mint Coriander Rice recipe - How to make Mint Coriander Rice
recipe_ing:
1 tbsp oil
 15 cashewnuts (kaju)
 2 cups chopped mint leaves (phudina)
 1 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 10 chopped curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1 tbsp tamarind (imli) pulp
 4 green chillies
 3 tbsp grated coconut
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp jaggery (gur)  (optional)
 a pinch of turmeric powder (haldi)
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 cup boiled kabuli chana (white chick peas)
 salt to taste
 2 1/2 cups steamed rice (chawal)
recipe:
Method
Heat 1 tsp of oil in a pan, add the cashewnuts and fry them till they turn light golden brown in colour. Keep aside.
In the same pan, heat 1/2 tsp oil and add the mint leaves, coriander and curry leaves and saute till they wilt.
Remove from the flame and keep aside to cool.
Blend the fried leaves along with coconut, tamarind pulp, half of the fried cashews, half of cumin seeds, jaggery (if using), green chillies and salt and blend in a mixer into smooth paste using sufficient water.
Heat the remaining oil in a pan, add the turmeric powder, asafoetida and the remaining cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the chana, cashew, salt and the grounded paste, mix well and saute on a slow flame for 5 to 7 minutes.
Add few tbsp of water if necessary.
Remove from the flame and add the steamed rice and mix well.
Serve hot.
tags: Gujarati Khichdi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 12 mins, Total Time: 27 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Khajur Amli Ni Chutney recipe - How to make Khajur Amli Ni Chutney
recipe_ing:
200 gms seedless dates (khajur)
 of tamarind (imli)
 1/4 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1/4 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Soak the dates and tamarind in a bowl in sufficient water for at least 4 hours.
Combine the khajur and imli and blend in a mixer to a smooth puree.
Transfer the mixture in a bowl.
Add the red chilli powder, coriander-cumin seeds powder, asafetida and salt and mix well.
Store in an air-tight container and keep refrigerated.
Use as required.
tags:
Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
different kinds of Indian chutney
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Chakli recipe - How to make Chakli
recipe_ing:
4 cups  water
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp home made white butter
 4 cups rice (chawal)
 2 cups chana dal (split Bengal gram)
 1 cup moong dal (split  green gram)
 1/2 cup urad dal (split black lentils)
 1 cup cumin seeds (jeera)
recipe:
To prepare the bhajani, roast the dals separately on a low flame.
Mix the dals and coarsely grind them.
Boil water and add red chilli powder, haldi, ajwain, til, salt and homemade butter.
Take four cups of bhajani and mix it in water.
Mix well and remove. put the mixture in a chakli maker.
Shape the chaklis and deep-fry them on low flame till reddish brown.
Remove and place on tissue to absorb excess oil.
Break a piece of the chakli to check if it has cooked properly.
Serve the chaklis with homemade butter, or fresh curd with chilli pickle.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Indian Jar Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 10, Cooking Time: nil, Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Dahi Bhaat ( Dahi Waale Chaawal) recipe - How to make Dahi Bhaat ( Dahi Waale Chaawal)
recipe_ing:
1 cup cooked rice
 1/2 cup chopped cucumber
 1/2 cup curds (dahi)
 1/4 cup milk
 2 tsp oil
 2 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 2 chopped green chillies
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 5 to 6 curry leaves (kadi patta)
recipe:
Method
Mash the cooked rice in a bowl and add the coriander, cucumber, salt, ginger and green chillies and mix well.
Heat the oil or ghee in a kadhai and add the red chillies and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and remove from the flame.
Remove the red chillies and keep it on side for garnish.
Now pour the milk on the rice and mix well.
Add the curd and the seasoning prepared with curry leaves and mustard seeds and mix well.
Garnish with red chillies and serve immediately or can be chilled.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
Traditional Indian Rice Recipes
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Bhakarwadi recipe - How to make Bhakarwadi
recipe_ing:
For The Dough:
 2/3 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 1/2 cups plain flour (maida)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 To Be Mixed Together For The Stuffing:
 1/2 tbsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 1/2 tbsp coriander (dhania) powder
 100 gms roasted poppy seeds (khus-khus)
 200 gms grated coconut
 3 green chillies
 2 tsp chopped ginger (adrak)
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 Other Ingredients:
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Sieve the besan, refined flour, chilli powder, asafoetida and salt together and transfer in a bowl.
Knead into a stiff dough along with 2 tsp oil and using little water. Keep aside.
Divide the stuffing into equal portions and keep aside.
Divide the dough into equal portions as the stuffing and roll out each portion into a small circle for 2" diameter.
Place a portion if the stuffing and roll out like a cylinder.
Make more such vadis using all the stuffing and dough.
Arrange all the flutes in a plate and steam for 20 minutes.
Cool and cut them into 2 cm round discs.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry these vadis till they turn golden brown and crisp.
Serve hot or store in an air-tight container.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Maharashtrian Snacks Nashta
Indian Jar Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Surti Sev Khamani recipe - How to make Surti Sev Khamani
recipe_ing:
1  lb chana dal (split Bengal gram)
 4 tbsp olive oil
 1  small piece ginger (adrak)
 5 to 10 green chillies
 3  cloves of garlic (lehsun)
 3 tbsp sugar
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tbsp lemon juice
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 coriander (dhania) leaves (garnishing)
 100 gms Sev
recipe:
Soak the chana dal for 3-4 hours in warm water. 
Drain the water and grind the chana dal coarse. make sure that the dal is not crushed very fine. add water if needed while grinding. 
Grind chillies, garlic, ginger and keep it aside.
Heat oil in the non-stick pan, add cumin seeds, when sizzle add pinch of asafetida stir 2-3 seconds.
Add grinded chana dal to the oil. sauté it on low-medium heat until the oil starts separating. (if dal is too dry you can add more oil while sauting)
Add chilly ginger garlic paste to the pan and sauté it for 3-4 minutes until the flavor of raw garlic is subtle.
Add salt, sugar and lemon juice per taste. mix well. take it off the heat and add sev
Garnish with choped coriander/celentro leaves. 
Serve hot, sprinkle fine thin sev when serving. (sev gets soggy if you let it sit for a while)
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Mother's Day
High Tea Party
Indian Birthday Party Snacks
Kitty Party Snacks
Monsoon Snacks, Evening Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 40 mins, Total Time: 55 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Aanar Ka Raita recipe - How to make Aanar Ka Raita
recipe_ing:
2 cups hung curds (chakka dahi)
 1 tbsp sugar
 1/2 tsp freshly ground black pepper powder
 1/2 tsp black salt (sanchal)
 1/4 tsp salt
 1/2 tsp dry mint powder
 1/2 cup fresh pomegranate (anar) seeds
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 15 to 20 raisins (kismis)
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Garnish with coriander and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Serve chilled.
tags:
Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
Jain Pickles / Chutneys / Raita / Salad
different kinds of Indian chutney
times: Preparation Time: 5 mins, Cooking Time: 6 mins, Total Time: 11 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Masala Chaas recipe - How to make Masala Chaas
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup curds (dahi)
 1/4 cup chopped coriander (dhania)
 1/4 cup mint leaves (phudina)
 2 green chillies , finely chopped
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera) powder
 2 tsp black salt (sanchal)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients along with 4 cups water and blend using a hand blender till coriander and mint leaves are finely crushed.
Serve chilled.
tags: Gujarati  Drinks
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Undhiyu recipe - How to make Undhiyu
recipe_ing:
100 gms surti surati beans  (fresh vaal) , stringed , whole
 100 gms chopped raw bananas , unpeeled
 100 gms yam (suran) cubes , peeled
 100 gms brinjal (baingan / eggplant) ,  slit
 4 to 5 green chillies , crushed
 1 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 1/2 tsp crushed garlic (lehsun)
 1 tbsp finely chopped coriander (dhania) leaves
 1 tsp whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 4 tbsp oil
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 salt to taste
 1/2 tbsp sugar
 lemon juice to taste
 For Methi Ghatta:
 100 gms finely chopped fenugreek (methi) leaves
 1/2 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tbsp grated coconut
 salt to taste
 1 tbsp oil
recipe:
For the ghatta
Mix all ingredients, make stiff dough.
Form into small oval, dumplings
Heat the 4 tbsp. Oil,fry ghattas for 2 minutes.
Remove from oil. Keep aside.
Use a heavy large sauce pan.
How to proceed
Form a paste of chilli, ginger, garlic, coriander,
Rub the chunky veggies with oil and masala paste.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil used for frying ghattas to proceed.
Add all the chunky vegetables, stir well.
Cover and cook for 4-5 minutes.
Add papdi, turmeric, flour, ajwain and salt.
Cover and cook on low till the yam is almost done.
Add coriander, lemon, and sprinkle some water if required.
Add sugar, stir.
Serve hot, either as is, or with parathas.
tags:
Gujarati Shaak Sabzi
Traditional Indian Sabzis
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 40 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Nutritious Moong Khichidi recipe - How to make Nutritious Moong Khichidi
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup roasted moong dal (split  green gram)
 1 cu rice (chawal)
 2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 onion , chopped
 2 to 3 whole dry kashmiri red chillies
 3 to 4 tbsp dessicated coconut
 2 to 3 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 1 tsp freshly ground black pepper powder
 2 tbsp oil
 4 to 5 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 salt to taste
 1 tsp finely chopped ginger (adrak)
 To Be Blended Into A Smooth Paste:
 3 tbsp freshly grated coconut
 4 to 5 green chillies
 1 1/2 tsp poppy seeds (khus-khus)
recipe:
Method
Clean and wash the rice with enough water. Drain and keep aside.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pressure cooker and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the onions and saute till they turn pink in colour.
Add the ground paste and roasted moong dal and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the rice, salt and 4 cups of water, mix well and pressure cook for 2 whistles or till rice is cooked.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Heat the remaining oil in a kadhai and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves, black pepper, ginger and the red chilles and saute for 20 seconds.
Add this to the cooker rice and dal and mix well.
Garnish it with the grated coconut and coriander.
Serve hot with green chutney.
tags: Gujarati Khichdi
times: Preparation Time: 30 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 50 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Instant Wheat Flour Chakali recipe - How to make Instant Wheat Flour Chakali
recipe_ing:
1 cup whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1/2 tsp red chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 water as required
recipe:
Method
Mix all the dry ingredients in a bowl and tie it in a cotton cloth to make a potli.
Place a small stand in a pressure cooker, add enough water and place the dry mixture potli on a sieve or in a small vessel and pressure cook for 15 minutes.
After steaming the mixture, add some water and knead to make a soft dough.
Divide the dough into 2-3 equal portions and roll each portion into a cylindrical shape.
Put the dough it into chakali maker and press out round whirls of the dough onto a newspaper or aluminium foil working closely from the centre to the outside of the whirl, you will get 12 to 15 chaklis.
Gently lift each chakli using a flat spoon and deep fry in hot oil over a medium flame till it is golden brown.
Drain on absorbent paper.
Store in an air-tight container.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Deep-fried Indian Starters
Deep Fry
Kadai Veg
Kids Jar Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 15  mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Patra recipe - How to make Patra
recipe_ing:
60 gms besan (bengal gram flour)
 1/4 tsp baking soda
 4 green chillies
 2 tsp chopped ginger (adrak)
 2 tsp jaggery (gur)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 3 tsp tamarind (imli)
 1 tsp crushed coriander (dhania) seeds
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 2 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Wash the colocasia leaves and keep aside.
Combine the green chilies and ginger and blend in a mixer till smooth and keep aside.
Sieve the besan and set aside.
Make a pulp with the tamarind and the jaggery and keep aside.
Combine the besan, and the tamarind pulp and mix well and add water to make a smooth thick batter.
Add the salt, spices and soda bicarbonate and mix well.
Take one colocasia leaf and place it on the opposite side.
Spread the batter evenly on the leaf and put another leaf on top of it and spread more batter.
Fold from both sides and roll tightly. Tie with a thread throughout the length of the roll.
Repeat the method for the rest of the leaves.
Steam for one hour in a steamer or in a water bath and keep aside to cool.
Slice the roll into ½" thick slices and keep aside,
Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the patra slices and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander and grated coconut.

times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Farali Cool Dessert recipe - How to make Farali Cool Dessert
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup sago (sabudana)  (medium size)
 sugar to taste
 1/2 cup saffron (kesar) strands flavoured cold milk , refer handy tip
 1 cup mango pulp
 water as required
recipe:
Method
Wash and soak the sago for 2 hours.
Take a thick bottomed pan and heat 2 to 3 cups water.
When the water starts boiling, add the sago.
Stir occasionally for 5 to 10 minutes.
Then add sugar and cook till the sugar melts.
Keep aside to cool.
Once cooled add the kesar flavoured cold milk and mango pulp.
Serve chilled.
Handy tip :
To make the kesar flavoured milk, add 4 to 5 strands of kesar to hot milk.

recipe_long_name: Mango Bhel recipe - How to make Mango Bhel
recipe_ing:
2 cups roasted puffed rice (kurmura)
 2 tsp finely chopped raw mango
 1 cup mangoes
 1/4 cup chopped spring onions
 2 tbsp finely chopped tomatoes
 2 tbsp finely chopped cucumber
 salt to taste
 roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder to taste
 4 tsp lemon juice
 To Garnish:
 finely chopped pineapple
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in a deep bowl and mix well.
Serve immediately garnished with pineapple pieces.
